intro: Paraboea glabriflora, commonly known as the smooth-flowered paraboea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or red. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in a fine pubescence. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
